Package parallel

parallel package: an implementation of all the synchronization, communication & coordination primitives required in popt4jlib.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ComparableTaskObject
    empty interface for use with dynamic, priority-based task msg-passing coordinators and executors.
    TaskObject
    interface defining what a TaskObject must support.
    ThreadSpecificComparableTaskObject
    interface for use with dynamic, priority-based task msg-passing coordinators and executors.
    ThreadSpecificTaskObject
    interface indicates that a specific Runnable must be run on a thread with the specified thread-id (or any thread, or any thread except a specific one).

    implements a "condition" counter, so that when the object's counter reaches a specified number, it releases a notification for any waiting thread to resume execution.
    DATE2Test
    class exercises DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor2 functionality by utilizing the Fib task: computing recursively in parallel the Fibonacci sequence using essentially a Fork-Join pattern (originally proposed for java by Doug Lea in his util.concurrent java package, based on the Cilk framework.)

    class exercises DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3 functionality by utilizing the Fib task: computing recursively in parallel the Fibonacci sequence using essentially a Fork-Join pattern (originally proposed for java by Doug Lea in his util.concurrent java package, based on the Cilk framework.)
    DATE3Test.Fib  
    DATE3Test.TSFib  
    DLCListNode  
    DMCoordinator
    Title: Thread Coordination Management System
    DMCT2LThread  
    DMCTest
    Title: parallel
    DMCTest2
    class simulates the data access synchronization processes in AMORE (AIT MOvie Recommendation Engine).
    DMCThread
    Title: parallel
    DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor
    A faster class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently tasks implementing the Runnable interface.
    DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor2
    an enhancement over DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor in that it augments its threads in its thread-pool with two local queues so that they first look for tasks in their "hot" local queue, then if no task is in the global queue either available for execution, they finally go into the "cold" queue.
    DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3
    Exactly the same as DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor2 class, only that the thread-pool's threads' hot local queue is also unbounded (as is the cold local queue), as is the global shared queue, so that all associated queues are unbounded, and therefore do not act as "synchronizers" between the executor threads (see Brian Goetz et al "Java Concurrency in Practice").
    ExecutorThread  
    FairDMCoordinator
    Title: Thread Coordination Management System
    FasterParallelAsynchBatchPriorityTaskExecutor
    A faster class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently batch of tasks implementing the ComparableTaskObject interface (or the extending interface, ThreadSpecificComparableTaskObject encapsulating the requirement that the task be run on a thread with a particular thread-id).
    FasterParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor
    A faster class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently a batch of tasks implementing the TaskObject, or more simply, the Runnable interface.
    FDMCTest
    tests the FairDMCoordinator class methods.
    FDMCThread  
    FIFOLock
    class that ensures First-In-First-Served lock acquisition among threads.
    FIFOLockTest
    tests the FairDMCoordinator class methods.
    FIFOLockThread  
    FPABPTEThread
    helper class for FasterParallelAsynchBatchPriorityTaskExecutor.
    FPABTETest  
    FPABTEThread
    helper class for FasterParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor.
    LimitedTimeTaskExecutor
    A class that allows its users to execute tasks (object that describe some computation that must implement the TaskObject interface) for a limited time, starting them in different threads than the thread that called the execute(task) method.
    Lock
    Standard Lock mechanism for thread coordination.

    RegisteredParcelPool
    The class is responsible for maintaining a sufficiently large array of RegisteredParcel objects, and there will be a pool for each thread of execution.
    RegisteredParcelPoolFailTest
    Tests the RegisteredParcel-pooling mechanism to show-case that in general it is broken in the presence of multiple msg-passing coordinators and multiple thread sending/receiving msgs among many of them.
    RegisteredParcelPoolFailTest.RPFailTestThread

    UnboundedBufferArrayUnsynchronized

    UnboundedSimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinator
    Exactly the same as SimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinator except that its queue is unbounded, and therefore cannot throw ParallelException in cases where having a full queue would throw.

  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ParallelException  
    ParallelExceptionUnsubmittedTasks
    encapsulates any unsubmitted tasks to executors.

Package parallel Description

parallel package: an implementation of all the synchronization, communication & coordination primitives required in popt4jlib.

Package Specification

Primitives required for the parallel implementation of the optimization algorithms in this library, including semaphores, atomic execution of critical sections, message passing, read/write shared/exclusive access (with built-in checking of the validity of the calls), barrier and ordered barriers, thread-pools and limited-time task executors.
